entry.title: Re: Document Compression in DMS.
entry.content:
Hi,

I've migrated the SAPoffice documents (SOFFCONT1) from Hana database to the SAP Document Management Service (BTP) at development system.

I was very surprised of explosing the data space on SAP Document Management Service wich is more than 27 bigger than in the Hana database.

The SOFFCONT1 table was 34.88 GB and after migration 964.38 GB on the BTP storage content. It was migrated without any ERROR's with the SAP standard report RSIRPIRL.

Any comment & hints are welcome

Toni Tschanz

entry.title: New certificate renewal process
entry.content:
Hello Team,

 

We are currently in the process of renewing certificates for our project.
For example, the existing certificate details are as follows:
CN=*

 

We plan to replace the organization name from O=* to O=**
Previously, when a certificate expired, we followed the steps below:
Step 1: If the certificate was expired or about to expire, we generated a new CSR from STRUST and requested a signature from the business team.
Step 2: Once approved, we received the signed certificate via email and downloaded it to our local system.
Step 3: If the certificate was self-signed, we imported the Root + CA + System certificates into STRUST.
Step 4: If the certificate was local, we imported it from the system and updated it.
Step 5: After updating the certificate in the system, we distributed it across applications and, if required, performed an ICM restart for the SSL certificate to take effect.

 

Since we are now changing the organization name, we would like your suggestions on the process.
Additionally, we have observed that some certificates in the system have already expired.

 


Please advise on the next steps as well as is there any easy steps to import the certificate.


Thank you,


--- Support Assistant ---
I have a problem in transaction STRUST


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: New certificate renewal process
entry.content:
For the renewal process, if you need to update the organization name from "O=*" to "O=**" you can use the Replacement Wizard Tool. 

Using this tool, you can modify the Distinguished Name and Subject Alternative Names attributes of the certificate, generate a key pair, and create a Certificate Signing Request.

Once you have the CSR, you can proceed with your current process to request the signature from your business team. After receiving the Certificate Signing Response, you can then use the Replacement Wizard Tool to complete the import process.

In order to make use of the Replacement Wizard tool, the system must have the corrections of SAP Note 2414090 - STRUST wizard to replace existing key pairs.

This requires a minimum of SAP_BASIS:   
740    SAPKB74017
750    SAPK-75007INSAPBASIS
751    SAPK-75102INSAPBASIS

The renew process is documented in the KBA 3431066 - How to sign a certificate using the Replacement Wizard tool which you can use it as reference.

entry.title: SAP TechEd Berlin 2025: SAP Business Data Cloud: Data products, master data, governance
entry.content:
Dear Data-Enthusiasts!

Are you still unsure how your data management approach can benefit of SAP Business Data Cloud, what data products are, and which advantages SAP-managed data products bring?

Then you might want to attend our session SAP Business Data Cloud: Data products, master data, and governance (DA100) at SAP TechEd in Berlin on Tuesday, Nov 4 at 9:30 AM.

Besides the questions above, we will also discuss the role of SAP Master Data Governance and how to use it for improved data quality, analytics, and AI.

We are Florian Neukirch @FlorianN and Andreas Seifried @AndreasSeifried, looking forward meeting you during and after our lecture!

Florian is a Senior Product Management Specialist for SAP BDC&I. His focus is on Data Products, Catalog, Marketplace and Data Product Governance. Florian started his career at SAP in Solution Management and has taken over several roles in the SAP BDC&I organization since then.

Andreas is a product manager for SAP Master Data Governance and is engaged in shaping SAP’s portfolio for data management since he joined the development organization in 2004. Andreas started at SAP as a technology consultant in 2001, when he helped organizations all over the world to solve their data and process integration challenges.

We will introduce you to the concept of data products and explore how SAP-managed data products can enhance your data architecture. We'll delve into the significance of master data for analytics, processes, and AI, and discuss upcoming features like the data product studio.

Other related sessions that we recommend:

  • DA203 | SAP Business Data Cloud: The path forward for SAP Business Warehouse by @kpsauer and @kurzdo93 
  • DA266 | Operationalizing AI with SAP Databricks in SAP Business Data Cloud by @san_tran 

Related community topic pages:

SAP Master Data Governance | SAP Community

SAP Business Data Cloud | SAP Community

SAP Datasphere | SAP Community

Looking forward to seeing you in Berlin!

Florian and Andreas

 

Now let’s hear from you:

  • What are your experiences with SAP Business Data Cloud and SAP Master Data Governance?
  • Is it valid to have distinct views on (generic) data management and master data management? What are the reasons?

Please add your thoughts as comments to this blog. Thanks!

entry.title: Re: Document Compression in DMS.
entry.content:
Hi,

this is a very good question and i've migrated the SAPoffice Hana database content SOFFCONT to CMIS content repository of SAP Document Management Service. The data store exploring in a range which is not usable.
On SAP development we have had in the SOFFCONT table 34.88 GB data space, and after migration 964.45 GB dataspace. 27.6 bigger than in the database.

I'm know that BLOB storage is very efficent and normaly if you migrate to SAP Content Server with compression you have only 5-6 time bigger data space.

So in this case the SAP Document Management Service store is not practicable also for pricing which is explosing.

Any hints are welcome

Toni Tschanz

entry.title: Realizan III Congreso Científico Nacional de Estudiantes de Contabilidad y el II Congreso Científico
entry.content:
Ver post original: Realizan III Congreso Científico Nacional de Estudiantes de Contabilidad y el II Congreso Científico Internacional de Estudiantes de Contabilidad de la Universidad de Panamá – Revista Hacia la Luz

uphacialaluz
17 octubre, 2025
2 minutos
 

La Facultad de Administración de Empresas y Contabilidad de la Universidad de Panamá, llevó a cabo el III Congreso Científico Nacional de Estudiantes de Contabilidad y el II Congreso Científico Internacional de Estudiantes de Contabilidad, eventos orientados a fomentar la investigación, el intercambio académico y la actualización profesional en el ámbito contable. Ambos encuentros se desarrollaron bajo el lema: “Innovación y Tecnología en la Contabilidad Moderna: Desafíos para el Profesional del Mañana”, y ofrecieron una variada programación de conferencias magistrales, ponencias estudiantiles y espacios de diálogo académico.

En un escenario global caracterizado por la creciente digitalización de los procesos empresariales y la continua transformación tecnológica del ámbito financiero, la formación de los futuros profesionales de la contabilidad implica la revisión y actualización de las competencias requeridas para su desempeño, herramientas y enfoques aplicados al ejercicio profesional. Conscientes de esta realidad, la Facultad de Administración de Empresas y Contabilidad organizó este congreso científico con el propósito de integrar la teoría y la práctica en torno a los avances tecnológicos que están redefiniendo la contabilidad moderna.

El evento reunió a destacados académicos, investigadores, profesionales y estudiantes del área contable, tanto a nivel nacional como internacional. Entre las actividades más destacadas se contó la conferencia del Ing. Carlos Cruz, Head of Solution Advisory Cloud ERP and Finance de la empresa SAP, quien presentó la ponencia titulada “SAP: Software de Gestión Financiera”. En su exposición, el ingeniero Cruz analizó las tendencias actuales en el uso de plataformas ERP  de SAP y soluciones en la nube para la optimización de los procesos financieros y contables, ofreciendo una visión práctica sobre la integración tecnológica en la gestión empresarial.

Desde el año 2024 la Universidad de Panamá cuenta con una alianza con SAP University Alliances para integrar las soluciones y recursos de SAP en su plan de estudios. Esta colaboración brinda a los estudiantes acceso a materiales educativos, software y la oportunidad de trabajar en desafíos empresariales reales, fortaleciendo así sus competencias y perspectivas profesionales en la economía digital. Este programa es una iniciativa global que busca reducir la brecha entre el mundo académico y el empresarial, proporcionando a docentes y estudiantes las más recientes tecnologías de SAP para el aprendizaje y la investigación. En la actualidad, más de 600 estudiantes de la Universidad de Panamá han recibido capacitación en la plataforma SAP.

La participación de expertos de alto nivel permitió a los asistentes conocer de primera mano las innovaciones que están transformando la contabilidad moderna, desde la automatización de procesos hasta la analítica avanzada y la aplicación de la inteligencia artificial en la gestión financiera.

Texto: Redacción / Foto: Cortesía FAECO

entry.title: SAP Access Management Use Cases can be enabled by SAP Gen AI
entry.content:
SAP Access Management Use Cases can be enabled by SAP Gen AI


1. Real-Time SoD Conflict Detection
Use Case: Instantly identify Segregation of Duties (SoD) conflicts for any user.
Example: “What conflicts exist for user Jacob?”
Benefit: Immediate, accurate conflict analysis.

2. Risk-Based Role Review
Use Case: Review roles based on actual risk exposure and usage.
Example: “Show me users with SOD risk conflicts”.
Benefit: Prioritize remediation based on real impact, not theoretical risk.

3. Usage-Based Role Optimization
Use Case: Identify unused roles or transactions to streamline access.
Example: “Who has Z_FB02 but never used FB02?”
Benefit: Reduce access footprint and license cost by removing unused permissions.

4. Impact Simulation for Role Changes
Use Case: Simulate the effect of removing a transaction or role.
Example: “If I remove FB02 from Z_FB02, who else is affected?”
Benefit: Avoid unintended disruptions by previewing changes.

5. Alternative Role Suggestions
Use Case: Recommend safer role alternatives.
Example: “What alternative roles could work instead of Z_FB02?”
Benefit: Accelerate remediation with validated, low-risk role options.

6. Executive Risk Reporting
Use Case: Explain access risks in business terms to leadership.
Example: “Explain our P2P risks to the CFO”
Benefit: Translate technical risks into business impact scenarios (e.g., fraud potential).

7. Visual Risk Mapping
Use Case: Generate visualizations of risk across business processes.
Example: “Create a visualization of the risk in the process flow”
Benefit: Improve stakeholder understanding and audit readiness.

8. Automated Audit Response
Use Case: Generate audit-ready reports and remediation plans.
Example: “Generate a slide deck for our SoD remediation progress”
Benefit: Save time and ensure completeness in compliance reporting.

9. Access Governance Across Hybrid Landscapes
Use Case: Manage access across on-premises and cloud SAP systems.
Example: “Show SoD violations across Cloud SAP S4 Hana systems and ECC systems”
Benefit: Unified view of access risks across environments.

10. Token-Efficient AI Conversations
Use Case: Enable deep AI reasoning without exceeding context limits.
Example: “Summarize top 5 risks by transaction volume”
Benefit: Fast, cost-effective AI interactions using pre-analyzed data.

🧭 Strategic Shift for Security Teams
Instead of being data gatherers, teams become strategic risk managers:
Focus on decision-making, not data extraction.
Use AI to triage, simulate, and remediate access risks.
Maintain audit readiness with minimal manual effort.

entry.title: Generative AI Powered IAM Business Role Augmentation (GAIRA)
entry.content:
Generative AI Powered IAM Business Role Augmentation (GAIRA) is a transformative concept for modern enterprises, shifting Identity and Access Management (IAM) from manual, reactive processes to a proactive, intelligent, and efficient system.

Limitations of traditional IAM include:

- Manual Provisioning: Managing user accounts and privileges can be time-consuming and error-prone, particularly in large organizations.
- Inflexible Security: Rule-based systems often lack the context needed to detect subtle, behavioral-based anomalies indicative of modern threats, such as insider risks.
- Compliance Burden: The manual nature of access reviews and audit trail generation drains resources and struggles to keep pace with regulatory changes.
- Subpar User Experience: Slow access request workflows can frustrate users and hinder productivity.

GAIRA addresses these challenges by integrating generative AI into the four pillars of IAM:

1. Adaptive Authentication
- Risk-Based Access: GAIRA enables continuous, risk-based authentication by analyzing user behavior, location, and device in real-time. For instance, a login attempt from an unusual location could trigger additional verification steps.
- Frictionless Security: This dynamic security approach balances convenience and trust, enhancing security without burdening trusted users.

2. Intelligent Authorization
- Automated Role Management: Generative AI analyzes historical access data and user roles to recommend optimal role assignments, significantly reducing manual effort and errors.
- Contextual Access Recommendations: For access requests needing approval, GAIRA provides context-rich insights based on peer-group comparisons and historical outcomes, facilitating faster, informed decisions.

3. Streamlined Administration
- Lifecycle Automation: GAIRA automates the entire user lifecycle, from onboarding to offboarding, dynamically assigning and removing access rights based on predefined policies and roles.
- Enhanced User Experience: Users can interact with the IAM system using natural language via conversational AI interfaces, improving productivity and reducing the burden on IT help desks.

entry.title: Recent Enhancements in SAP for Me for Partners
entry.content:
Dear Partners,

Based on your valued feedback, we have introduced new functionality and enhancements to the partner accessible dashboards in SAP for Me.

Customer Success Dashboard

Projects - Customer Implementation Survey report

Partners can now access survey results completed by customers after they complete the survey, post project implementation.

This enhancement provides partners with direct visibility into customer feedback, helping them:

  • Understand customer satisfaction and areas for improvement.
  • Track implementation success metrics.
  • Identify opportunities for follow-up or continuous improvement.

Sales & Marketing Dashboard

Reselling Business Suite via SAP Store

In the Deal Execution tab, partners can easily resell Business Suite via the SAP Store in the Open Deals card.  First, select "My Deals" from the filter option to identify the relevant opportunity, then click on Manage Deal and then Create Cart option. This will allow partners to configure their shopping card in the SAP Store, generate a quote for the customer and place the order.

Check out this video to review the end-to-end process.

Exceptional Discount Requests

In the Deal Execution tab > Exceptional Discount Requests card, partners can now upload documents to their Exceptional Discount Requests via SAP for Me, removing the requirement to provide documentation to SAP via email.

 

Partnership Dashboard

Competencies & Specializations: Enhanced view and transparency for partners and competency achievements

We’ve introduced an improved experience that gives partners greater visibility into their competency progress and achievements. With this enhancement, partners can view detailed progress toward each competency requirement.

This increased transparency empowers partners to better manage their competency requirements, plan next steps proactively, and accelerate their path toward higher competency levels.

 

GSSP Download letter

To support partner autonomy, GSSP partners can now automatically generate a letter as proof of partnership letter via SAP for Me, to leverage in customer tendering processes.

Finance & Legal Dashboard

Digital Terminations

The scope of digital terminations has been extended to enable customers to trigger terminations for Cloud Choice Flex (CCFLEX) contracts via SAP for Me. Partners can trigger terminations for OEM and Test, Demo and Development contracts. Please note, only standard termination is possible.

Termination can be triggered in Finance & Legal dashboard > Cloud > Contracts

   

 

Coming soon:

Customer Success Dashboard:

  • New insights to support renewal forecasting
  • Updates to Projects Card: project view by partner group, Clean Core Quality Gate visibility and project manager assignment
  • Business AI unit consumption

Finance & Legal Dashboard:

  • Enhancements to CCLFEX Commissions card

Partner Solutions Dashboard:

  • Solex Customer Billing for Partner

Sales & Marketing

  • Enhancements to the Business Planning card

If you would like to suggest a new feature for SAP for Me, please access here. Your feedback matters and supports to shape the roadmap for SAP for Me for Partner.

entry.title: Ariba Supplier Log in issues? Find out how to get support!
entry.content:
The Ariba Supplier Help Center is your one-stop shop for all your Ariba Supplier support needs, offering a wide range of tools and resources to help you navigate the network efficiently.  

Below is the process to find answers to common queries as well as the steps to contact the Ariba Supplier Support Team should you have log in issues. 

Access the Ariba Supplier Help Center by following these steps: 

  1. Visit SAP Ariba Help Center 
  2. Select your account type. 
  3. Search in the search bar using key words for common queries and Ariba Supplier troubleshooting tips. 

Contact the Ariba Supplier Support Team by following these steps: 

  • Go to the Get Support tab in the top-left corner of the Help Center and click Contact Support. 
  • Step 1: Add your question or issue (e.g. Can not log in), then click Next (button will appear after adding your question). 

  • Step 2: Open and review the resources, then click Next. 
  • Step 3 Confirm the requested details, then click Next. 
  • Step 4: Choose from the available Contact Options.  

Depending on your account type, subscription and the nature of your issue, SAP Ariba Supplier Support will guide you towards one of the following support options: Request a Call, Chat, Email Webform.  

                                                                                                                                           

Don’t forget to continue exploring the Help Center and check out the Knowledge Base and Documentation sections for a wealth of information!  

Please see the following links for further assistance: 

Who do I contact when I have a question or issue? Ariba or Customer? 

How do I contact SAP Business Network Customer Support as a supplier?  

How do I Chat with SAP Business Network Customer Support if I cannot log into my SAP Business Network Account? 

                                                                                                                                           

Thanks for reading!   

We hope you found this useful. Please note that the Customer Interaction Center is always happy to guide you on any of the mentioned processes and assist you with any queries you may have. 

If you have any questions, please ask a questions in the Q & A using All Questions in Customer Experience | SAP Community and All Questions in Support Services | SAP Community

Read more ##CustomerInteractionCenter blog-posts here!

@normann 

Entra is the source of truth and the "id" there is the most suitable field. This is aligned with the docummentatiom below wich then is just possible "in theory" but is not valid in practical use cases.

https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-identity/system-integration-guide/step-by-step-example-for-setting-up-global-user-id

UUID from IAS differ from Test to Prod wich is something we don't want. Also in case of SSFF tenant Refresh the useres are re-created in IAS with new UUIDs, so the value ends up beign mutable and not valid for its purpose. 

The integration with SSFF must be fixed to allow this escwnario, otherwise the documentation above has no sense at all

entry.title: Fiori Elements List Reportでのファイルアップロード
entry.content:
1. はじめに

このブログでは、SAP Fiori ElementsのList Reportで、各行（アイテム）に対して“添付ファイル“のような項目を持たせ、行単位でファイルのアップロード・参照・削除の実現方法を紹介します。
List Reportのデータソースは、ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model（RAP）フレームワークを使用して開発したOData V4サービスを対象とし、RAP開発においてファイルアップロードを実現するために必要な実装についての内容となっています。

 

2. ファイルアップロード実装のポイント

ファイルアップロード実装においては、①ファイル格納に必要なテーブル項目の定義、および、②ファイルオブジェクト格納用項目とファイルタイプ格納用項目への適切なアノテーション付与の2点が必要となります。

  1. ファイル格納に必要なテーブル項目の定義

    カスタムテーブルに以下の3つの項目を設定します（項目名は、サンプルです。）

    • ファイルオブジェクト格納用項目（ファイルサイズを指定しない場合、abap.rawstring(0)とする）
      • 例：attachment: abap.rawstring(0);
    • ファイル名格納用項目
      • 例：filename: abap.char(128);
    • ファイルタイプ格納用項目
      • 例：mimetype: abap.char(128);
  2. CDS Viewでのファイルオブジェクト格納用項目とファイルタイプ格納用項目への適切なアノテーション付与
    • ファイルオブジェクト格納用項目
      • 例：
@Semantics.largeObject : {
mimeType: 'Mimetype',
fileName: 'Filename',
contentDispositionPreference: #INLINE
}​
    • ファイルタイプ格納用項目
      • @Semantics.mimeType: true

3. 実装例

本ブログでは、RAP開発の簡略化のため、RAP Generatorを使用します。RAP Generatorは、カスタムテーブルからCDS ViewやBehavior Definition等のRAP オブジェクト群をウィザードによる設定のみで生成可能なツールです。RAP Generator を利用して RAP オブジェクトを生成する場合、ドラフト機能を持つ更新処理（Managed Runtime）に対応したサービスが生成されます。そのため、テーブル定義にドラフト機能や更新処理に利用するための必須項目を定義している必要があります。RAP Generatorについては、以下のSAP Helpをご確認ください。

SAP Help: Generating a RAP Business Service with the Generate ABAP Repository Objects Wizards

以下の実装手順は、SAP Help: Example: OData UI Service Generation Based on a Database Tableのサンプルをベースとした実装例となります。

 

1. RAP Generatorによるオブジェクトを格納するためのパッケージを作成します。

2. １で作成したパッケージ内にカスタムテーブルを作成します。



 

@EndUserText.label : 'Custom Table for file upload test'
@AbapCatalog.enhancement.category : #NOT_EXTENSIBLE
@AbapCatalog.tableCategory : #TRANSPARENT
@AbapCatalog.deliveryClass : #A
@AbapCatalog.dataMaintenance : #RESTRICTED
define table zpt_file_upload {

  key client            : abap.clnt not null;
  key customer_id       : /dmo/customer_id not null;
  first_name            : /dmo/first_name;
  last_name             : /dmo/last_name;
  title                 : /dmo/title;
  street                : /dmo/street;
  postal_code           : /dmo/postal_code;
  city                  : /dmo/city;
  country_code          : land1;
  phone_number          : /dmo/phone_number;
  email_address         : /dmo/email_address;
  attachment            : abap.rawstring(0);
  filename              : abap.char(128);
  mimetype              : abap.char(128);
  local_created_by      : abp_creation_user;
  local_created_at      : abp_creation_tstmpl;
  local_last_changed_by : abp_locinst_lastchange_user;
  local_last_changed_at : abp_locinst_lastchange_tstmpl;
  last_changed_at       : abp_lastchange_tstmpl;

}​

 

3. RAP Generatorを実行し、ウィザードに沿って設定します。

対象のカスタムテーブルを右クリック→”Generate ABAP Repository Objects…” で実行

 

 

サービスタイプの選択

 

 

生成オブジェクト格納用パッケージの選択

 

 

生成されるオブジェクトを確認し、必要に応じて名称変更やエイリアス名を設定


 

4. 生成されたデータモデル（CDS View）へファイルアップロードのためのアノテーションを追加し、有効化します。

@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #CHECK
@EndUserText.label: '##GENERATED ZPT_FILE_UPLOAD'
define root view entity ZR_PT_FILE_UPLOAD
  as select from zpt_file_upload
{
  key customer_id           as CustomerID,
      first_name            as FirstName,
      last_name             as LastName,
      title                 as Title,
      street                as Street,
      postal_code           as PostalCode,
      city                  as City,
      country_code          as CountryCode,
      phone_number          as PhoneNumber,
      email_address         as EmailAddress,
      @Semantics.largeObject : {
            mimeType: 'Mimetype',
            fileName: 'Filename',
            contentDispositionPreference: #INLINE
          }
      attachment            as Attachment,
      filename              as Filename,
      @Semantics.mimeType: true
      mimetype              as Mimetype,
      @Semantics.user.createdBy: true
      local_created_by      as LocalCreatedBy,
      @Semantics.systemDateTime.createdAt: true
      local_created_at      as LocalCreatedAt,
      @Semantics.user.localInstanceLastChangedBy: true
      local_last_changed_by as LocalLastChangedBy,
      @Semantics.systemDateTime.localInstanceLastChangedAt: true
      local_last_changed_at as LocalLastChangedAt,
      @Semantics.systemDateTime.lastChangedAt: true
      last_changed_at       as LastChangedAt

}

5. サービスバインディングを公開します。

 

6. エンティティを選択して、プレビューします。

 

7. “Create”ボタンからデータの登録およびファイルのアップロードを実行します。







 

4. まとめ

上記の実装により、ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model（RAP）を用いたOData V4サービスを利用し、SAP Fiori ElementsのList Reportで各行（アイテム）ごとに“添付ファイル”項目を持たせ、行単位でファイルのアップロード・参照・削除を実現することが可能です。是非ご活用下さい。

 

参考情報

SAPUI5 Document: Enabling Stream Support

entry.title: PO Fields Missing in Line Item Reports
entry.content:
In SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition, the Purchase Order (PO) field in the Supplier Line Item Report appears empty when an invoice is posted.
However, the PO field appears correctly for advance payments.

The issue occurs under both conditions:

  • One Purchase Order against one Invoice

  • Multiple Purchase Orders against one Invoice


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: PO Fields Missing in Line Item Reports
entry.content:
Hi,

Currently, there is no standard SAP configuration or modification available to automatically populate the PO field in the supplier line item report for invoice postings.

Several purchase orders can be combined into one invoice. As there is usually exactly one line item per invoice, it’s impossible to display purchase order details in the Manage Supplier Line Items app.

If you only want to know the supplier invoice number, you can add the Original Reference Document column and the Reference Document Type column to the table in the Manage Supplier Line Items app.

To get a complete overview of the documents related to a line item, we recommend opening the Manage Journal Entries app and navigating to the Related Documents tab.

Refer to Manage Supplier Line Items: FAQ

Best regards,
SAP Support

entry.title: Re: In SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, We can't use the...
entry.content:
Hello @Kimaro 

Thank you for your feedback and follow-up

To adjust cumulative allocations in SAP S/4HANA profit centers, use a combination of the

Manage Allocations and Run Allocations Fiori apps. This process is part of the Universal Allocation function, which streamlines the allocation of overhead costs. 

Manage Allocations

First, use the Manage Allocations app to define or edit the allocation cycle, which sets rules for distributing costs and revenues among controlling objects. 

What you could do in this app

  • Create or modify an allocation cycle using the Profit Centers allocation context to define it.
  • Define segments. During the cycle, generate segments that specify the sender, the profit center providing the allocation and the receiver the profit center receiving the allocation
  • Establish rules: You can select various rules for how amounts are allocated, including fixed amounts, fixed percentages, or based on a statistical key figure (SKF)
  • Handle cumulative behaviour. The system can manage cumulative allocations by performing a monthly true-up adjustment within the same allocation cycle

Step 2: Run Allocations

After configuring the cycle, you then use the Run Allocations app to execute the allocation cycle you have defined.

 

Let me know if you need further information

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Bellwethers: Q3 road cargo, marine cargo, pharmaceutical, and heavy equipment trends
entry.content:
After reading "Where U.S. Medicines Are Made and How Trump’s Tariffs Could Affect Them" in the New York Times last spring, I began tracking pharmaceutical spend on the network another potential indicator of supply chain disruption across our community.

U.S. Pharmacopeia, a nonprofit tracking prescription drug supply, shared data with the Times showing that newer, more expensive patent-protected drugs, like those for cancer and obesity, tend to have their active ingredients made in Europe or the United States. India and China; however, focus on lower-cost generics, such as statins and antibiotics, which account for a vast majority of prescriptions.

Some of the network’s biggest and most successful customers are in in the pharmaceutical industry.  Historically pharmaceutical spend on the network has been stable year over year.  However, we saw two spikes in 2025 as pharmaceutical companies raced to get ahead of tariffs in 2025.

Road and marine cargo spend dropped in Q3.  This aligns with a citing from Zipline Logistics who indicated the freight market began recalibrating in Q3. Zipline attributes the changes as driven by a cooling economy, persistent inflation, and shifting trade policies.

Although heavy equipment show a strong downward trend in Q2, heavy equipment spend in Q3 showed some resiliency with alternating dips and rebounds of +/- 25% each month.  Q3 heavy equipment spend increase 1% compared to Q2.  These changes appear to align to predictions made by Equipment Leasing & Finance Foundation who noted that investment growth likely slowed markedly in Q2, but if the Fed cuts rates in Q3 and Q4 as anticipated, it could provide a modest boost to investment later this year.  

 

Sources

  • "Where U.S. Medicines Are Made and How Trump’s Tariffs Could Affect Them" - the New York Times
  • "U.S. Economic Outlook - Equipment Leasing & Finance Foundation" - Equipment Leasing & Finance Foundation
  • "2025 Q3 Freight Market Update & Predictions" - Zipline Logistics

entry.title: Re: SolMan 7.2 Modifying UI5 apps
entry.content:
In case you modify apps in se80 directly, use the following steps to make it working:

 

https://<server>:<port>/sap/bc/ui2/flp?sap-ui-xx-componentPreload=off

https://me.sap.com/notes/0002792008

https://me.sap.com/notes/2426124/

In case you are using Eclipse, you have the following options:

  • Use the URL parameter sap-ui-xx-componentPreload=off to avoid the component-preload.js file. This parameter can be added in the Launchpad Designer, where the tile is configured. This way, all users will have the parameter in the URL when clicking the tile for this app, but will still load the Component-preload.js file for other apps.
  • Component-preload.js file can be deleted as it is not mandatory. Therefore the application will run even if this file does not exist. The Fiori Launchpad will always try to load it, so a 404 error will be received in the console and the network traces. After this 404, the FLP will request the Component.js file and then all the other files. As a general recommendation please create a backup before deleting any file.

SAP strongly recommends to use SAP Web IDE to develop applications.

 

Note: Never use transaction SE80 directly to delete the Component-preload file. Eclipse or SAP Web IDE should be used to do so. (or report /ui5/ui5_repository_load)

entry.title: Clarification on Total Limit and Utilization of Custom Fields Across Business Contexts
entry.content:
Dear SAP, 

 

I would like to get clarification on the following questions: 

  1. What is the total limit of Custom Fields available per Business Context?

  2. For the Business Contexts “Sales Document” and “Sales Document Item”, what exactly is the limit?

  3. Is the limit defined in KB/MB or by the number of characters? Please specify the exact storage capacity (e.g., how many KBs/MBs or characters can be stored).

  4. How is the limit utilization calculated or monitored for Custom Fields? For instance, how can we determine how much of the allowed capacity has already been consumed?

 

Can you help?

Thanks! 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Clarification on Total Limit and Utilization of Custo...
entry.content:
Dear Customer,

 

Check below the answer for your questions: 

  1. What is the total limit of Custom Fields available per Business Context?
    This is defined by each Business Context. For each business context, the responsible SAP application department defines the capacity available for customers individually.
    The only guard rail that exists is that the number of fields reserved for customers is never less than 100 fields and never less than 1000 characters. 

  2. For the Business Contexts “Sales Document” and “Sales Document Item”, what exactly is the limit?
    The limit for "Sales Document" and "Sales Document Item" is below:
    Maximum Fields: 170
    Maximum Capacity (e.g. number of characters): 1,700 

  3. Is the limit defined in KB/MB or by the number of characters? Please specify the exact storage capacity (e.g., how many KBs/MBs or characters can be stored).
    The limit is defined by fields and characters. You can also see the limit in bytes (Check answer for question 4). The amount of capacity that a field requires depends on its type and the defined length. 

  4. How is the limit utilization calculated or monitored for Custom Fields? For instance, how can we determine how much of the allowed capacity has already been consumed?
    You can figure out easily how much capacity for a given business context is left. This is directly shown while creating a new field using the Custom Fields app.

    The field “Business Context Capacity” displays a percentage number telling you which percentage of the overall available capacity reserved for customers has already been consumed. When you hover over the “Business Context Capacity” bar, you see how many fields and how many bytes are available (see screenshot). As a rule of thumb, you can divide the number of bytes by factor 2 to get the free number of characters.

    Also you can see the remaining capacity when you open the value help on the business context field of the “New Field” popup and then on the very right column you see the remaining capacity for the business contexts listed (see screenshot below).

    You can also check the remaining capacity in the Extensibility Cockpit app.

     

For more information, check the following documentations:

  • Key User Custom Fields: Maximum number of fields and characters
  • 3612451 - Custom Fields - Frequently Asked Questions - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
  • Before Getting Started with Custom Fields
  • Extensibility Cockpit

 

Kind regards,

SAP Support.

entry.title: How to get import error logs in HANA Cloud?
entry.content:
I'm importing some datasets to SAP HANA Cloud, using IMPORT FROM. 

Normally, when import fails, I can look at the ERROR LOG file and get some details. But, I don't think this is possible to do in Hana Cloud, given there's no filesystem... right?

CREATE TABLE "FOO"."BAR" (
  id   VARCHAR(256) PRIMARY KEY
  name NVARCHAR(5000) NOT NULL
  ts TIMESTAMP NOT NULL
);

IMPORT FROM PARQUET FILE
'gs://foo/bar/000000000000.parquet'
INTO "FOO"."BAR"
WITH
FAIL ON INVALID DATA
CREDENTIAL 'GCS'
COLUMN LIST (id, name, ts)
FILE COLUMN LIST (1,2,3);

If there's an issue with the file, the import will fail with a generic some of rows have failed to be imported error.
How can I get more details on the error?

I've tried adding an error log, but that option causes the import to immediately fail. I'm not even sure if it's applicable to HANA Cloud; I'm not sure what is a valid file path in HANA Cloud, or even how I'd retrieve that error log file.

So, how are you guys getting details on import errors, in HANA Cloud?

entry.title: SAP TDF: SP20 – What’s New
entry.content:
To read this blog post in Portuguese, go to link. 

 

SAP Tax Declaration Framework released Support Package 20, delivering improvements for various topics. See our  What’s New in the Help Portal for details.

To check prerequisites and recommendations for the SP20, see the Release Information Note.

Updates to the Guides in the Help Portal

Changes were made to the following guides (all available in English):

  • Installation Guide, learn how to install/update your system with SP20 according to your installation scenario.
  • Configuration Guide, learn how to configure SAP TDF.

Other available guides on our Help Portal page:

  • Administrator’s Guide
  • Developer’s Guide

Remember that the IMG activities, SAP menu, and translations are only updated with the Support Package. Therefore, we strongly recommend installing SP20.

We would like to inform you that this is the final support package planned to be released for the SAP Tax Declaration Framework for Brazil application. From this point onward, all subsequent updates and corrections will be delivered exclusively through SAP Notes. We emphasize that the official maintenance of the SAP Tax Declaration Framework for Brazil is scheduled to end on December 31, 2027.

Your feedback is valuable. If you have any questions or suggestions for an upcoming post, please leave your comment below. In addition to the comment section, you can also contact us through the Customer Influence platform, where you can propose ideas to improve our product, vote on previously released ideas, and follow those ideas being implemented. Follow the SAP Tax Declaration Framework for Brazil tag here at the SAP Community to keep updated with the latest news on the TDF Add-On.

See you next time!

SAP TDF Development Team

Lembre que os Customizing, menus e a tradução só são atualizados via Support Package. Por essa razão, recomendamos fortemente a instalação do SP20.

Gostaríamos de informar que este é o último support package planejado para o SAP Tax Declaration Framework for Brazil. A partir deste momento, todas as atualizações e correções subsequentes serão fornecidas exclusivamente por meio de SAP Notes. Ressaltamos que a manutenção oficial do SAP Tax Declaration Framework for Brazil está programada para terminar em 31 de dezembro de 2027.

Seu feedback é muito importante. Deixe seu comentário abaixo caso tenha alguma dúvida ou sugestão para um próximo post. Não esqueça de seguir a tag SAP Tax Declaration Framework for Brazil aqui na SAP Community para ficar ligado nas últimas notícias sobre o Tax Declaration Framework (TDF).

Até a próxima!

Equipe de desenvolvimento do SAP TDF

entry.title: Re: Accept Zero as a valid value in a currency field
entry.content:
ABAP cannot distinguish between 0 and empty. One option would be to add a second boolean null indicator field to the database and annotate it.

Then it is possible to distinguish  between 0 and NULL. If  the  boolean value is true RAP returns  null in oData otherwise it returns the value of the field. Also the Null Indicator field is not part of the $metadata RAP takes care of handling the fields.

I do not know out of the box if this also solves your mandatory field problem.

https://github.com/SAP-samples/abap-platform-fiori-feature-showcase/wiki/Feature-Showcase-App-Guide#quickview-with-non-uuid-key---nullvalueindicator

entry.title: 2H 2025: New Innovations and Excitement in Recruiting
entry.content:
With the 2H 2025 release, we have delivered new capabilities within SAP SuccessFactors Recruiting to improve how organizations attract and hire the best talent.  

Through customer influence on the Customer Community and innovative product enhancements, we are bringing your ideas to life and driving improvements across the recruiting experience.

To learn more watch the on-demand Q&A webinars: 2H 2025 Product Release Webinars. Join us on October 27th for the Recruiting & Onboarding 2H 2025 Customer Release Q&A session! To hear more about the roadmap and broader view of our strategy, watch the VIP Virtual Program for Strategic Roadmap Updates.    

All of the 2H 2025 release items can be found on the What’s New Viewer. These new features will be live in Production on November 16th, 2025.

This release brings enhanced recruiting capabilities to the SAP SuccessFactors Recruiting solution, enabling hiring teams to streamline key recruiting activities and uncover hiring insights with ease.

LinkedIn Recruiter System Connect Integration

With LinkedIn’s Recruiter System Connect, recruiters can stay focused on their activities in either SAP SuccessFactors Recruiting or on LinkedIn Recruiter – with access to real-time candidate details from LinkedIn without leaving SAP SuccessFactors Recruiting and vice versa.

The integration of LinkedIn Recruiter with SAP SuccessFactors Recruiting enables seamless data sharing and synchronization between the two platforms, including key recruiting data such as applications, requisitions, and up-to-date candidate skills and experience.

Recruiters can now easily view and import candidate profiles from LinkedIn, enabling them to find and hire top talent faster. Recruiters can also view up to date SAP SuccessFactors Recruiting candidate and applicant records directly in LinkedIn Recruiter. 

People Intelligence for Recruiting in SAP Business Data Cloud

The People Intelligence package in SAP Business Data Cloud helps you analyze your HR data together with your business data, and make better data-driven decisions for your organization.

People Intelligence is a people analytics solution that automatically brings together your workforce, skills, and business data, from SAP SuccessFactors and other sources into clear and actionable insights, empowering you to make informed decisions that benefit your organization.

The Recruiting data model is designed to provide comprehensive reporting and analytics on recruitment lifecycle processes. It aggregates key recruiting metrics such as applications, requisitions, hires, and candidate conversions to enable recruiters and HR managers to optimize their recruitment strategies. This allows organizations to access ready-made insights that cover the most critical recruiting metrics, as well as built their own insights.  

SmartRecruiters, an SAP Company

With the completion of the SmartRecruiters acquisition, we’re expanding support for high-volume hiring, recruitment automation, and AI-assisted candidate engagement. As integration progresses, SmartRecruiters’ user-friendly workflows and built-in analytics will enhance the SAP SuccessFactors HCM suite, accelerating hiring, deepening insights, and creating a more seamless experience across the entire talent acquisition process.

Continuously Delivering Enhancements     

With every release, we are excited to deliver these new innovations and continue our journey of providing even greater value to our customers. For full details, please check out the 2H 2025 Release Highlights Resources: 

  • 2H 2025 Release Highlights Brochure
  • 2H 2025 Release Highlights Video 
  • 2H 2025 Release Highlights News Article 
  • Product Release & Road Map Information

Learn more about SAP SuccessFactors Recruiting.

entry.title: Optimizing Dynamic Group Creation and simplifying rule for New Hire Data Review
entry.content:
Optimizing Dynamic Group Creation and New Hire Data Review

 

My client had a large number of offices and training locations—around 250+—each responsible for reviewing new hire data for incoming employees. This created a need for multiple Dynamic Groups and a complex set of rules to select the correct locations based on predefined criteria.

 

To simplify this, we implemented a structured solution, which I will explain step by step below.

 

Step 1: Configuring the Training Location Field in Recruiting

 

At the application stage, where the correct location for the employee is selected during the recruiting process, we created a Training Location field with the same picklist values as in Employee Central (EC).

 

This field carries the value over to EC, which becomes the **key deciding factor** for determining which group will be selected for reviewing new hire data.

 

Note: This blog does not cover how to create a field in the RCM application or how to map that field to ONB.

 

 

 

Step 2: Creating and Configuring the Object

 

Once the field was set up, we created an object as shown below.

 

Please ensure that the following fields are configured as indicated:

 

 

Object: cust_ONB2ResponsibilityDetailConfig

 

* The second field must match the value from Recruiting. It should have the same data type and field configuration as in Recruiting to enable proper mapping and data transfer to Onboarding.

 

 

Step 3: Setting Permissions

It’s essential to assign the correct permissions to the object before entering data.

 

 

Once the permissions are set, the object should appear as shown below:

 

 

---

 

Step 4: Creating the Business Rule

 

Next, we designed a **business rule** to control the group selection logic. This rule determines which dynamic group should be picked based on the training location value passed from Recruiting.

 

 

---

 

Data Collection Object Configuration

 

The second part of the requirement involved handling **various data collection UIs**, which the customer wanted to display based on specific conditions.

 

To achieve this, we created a **new object definition** as illustrated below:

 

 

We added the **foundation object: Location Group**, since each combination of **Location Group + Company + Employee Group** determines the type of object to be displayed.

 

 

 

 

Additionally, the **Object UI** must include the following configuration:

 

 

Once the object is uploaded, it should look like this:

 

 

 

Finally, we designed a Rule to pick the appropriate lookup table configuration**. The rule should resemble the structure shown below:

 

 

Conclusion

 

By standardizing the location field, creating a well-structured object, and designing targeted business rules, we were able to eliminate the need for lengthy line items in dynamic group creation. This approach not only improves system performance but also provides flexibility in data collection UI configuration based on location and organizational attributes.

entry.title: IF_RAP_QUERY_PROVIDER~SELECT called two times causing issues
entry.content:
I built an RAP application with Header and Item using Custom Entities as I need to call external API for fetching the data.

The Select Query is called twice, once with Offset 0 and second with Offset 34. Upon Execution for the first time I have all the data fetched and I am setting the Number of Records Fetched and data. However, since the query is called twice, with offset greater than number of records, the select query is failing and throwing an error message.

Please help on how to prevent the error message

Below is my code

  METHOD if_rap_query_provider~select.
** Check if data is requested.
    DATA(lv_requested) = io_request->is_data_requested( ).
    IF lv_requested IS NOT INITIAL.
      DATA(lv_entity_id) = io_request->get_entity_id( ).
      CASE lv_entity_id.
** get the bank balance
        WHEN 'YYYYYYY'.
          get_YYYYYYY(
            EXPORTING
              io_request  = io_request
              io_response = io_response
          ).
** Get the Bank statement
        WHEN 'XXXXXXX'.
          get_XXXXXXX(
            EXPORTING
              io_request  = io_request
              io_response = io_response
          ).
        WHEN OTHERS.
      ENDCASE.
    ENDIF.
  ENDMETHOD.

**********  Entity Method logic
  METHOD get_YYYYYY.
**paging
    DATA(lv_offset) = io_request->get_paging( )->get_offset( ).
    DATA(lv_page_size) = io_request->get_paging( )->get_page_size( ).
    DATA(lv_max_rows) = COND #( WHEN lv_page_size = if_rap_query_paging=>page_size_unlimited
                                THEN 0 ELSE lv_page_size ).

** Get the search criteria
    DATA(lv_sql_filter) = io_request->get_filter( )->get_as_sql_string( ).

**search string
    DATA(lv_search_string) = io_request->get_search_expression( ).

    SELECT ******<Logic>
      INTO TABLE @LT_Itab
      UP TO @LV_max_rows ROWS OFFSET @LV_offset ##TOO_MANY_ITAB_FIELDS.
    IF sy-subrc NE 0.
      ls_message-msgid = gc_msgid.
      ls_message-msgno = '042'.
* No Data found for the given criteria
    ENDIF.

    IF ls_message IS NOT INITIAL.
      RAISE EXCEPTION TYPE zcx_exception
        EXPORTING
          textid = ls_message.
    ENDIF.

    IF io_request->is_total_numb_of_rec_requested( ).
      io_response->set_total_number_of_records( lines( lt_itab ) ).
    ENDIF.

    io_response->set_data( lt_itab ).

  ENDMETHOD.

Service Definition

entry.content:

in a RAP behavior determination I'm trying to modify the scheduling line of an sales order item:

MODIFY ENTITIES OF i_salesordertp

      UPDATE FROM VALUE #( for k in dlv(

        SalesOrderItem = k-SalesOrderItem

      SchedulineLine   = k-SalesOrderSchedLIne

     RequestedDeliveryDate = k-DeliveryDate

   %control-RequestedDeliveryDate = if_abap_behv=>mk-on ))

    FAILED data(ls_failed)

For a single entry it works but if I have more than one entry in table dlv I got an an error in table ls_failed for each entry like the following:

Any suggestions ?

entry.title: Re: Future of Feature Toggles
entry.content:
Unfortunately, in 2025, I don't see any future for custom usage, but maybe later... : Solved: Unable to create "Switch-Based Feature Toggles" - SAP Community

Transaction FTGL is read-only.

Switch-Based Feature Toggles are read-only (dixit Feature Toggle Editor | SAP Help Portal).

Workaround: you may use the Switch Framework instead, though it may look overcomplicated for features of few lines of code.

NB: CL_FEATURE_TOGGLE (belongs to FTGL) still exists in ABAP 7.58 - S/4HANA 2023 FPS 01 ON-PREMISE.

entry.title: SAM DM Pod execution plugin to do a HTTP POST operation to S/4HANA Cloud api
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I have built a POD synchronous  execution plugin based on the sample available in dm-podplugin-extensions/ExtensionPodPluginTemplate_and_Example at https://github.com/SAP-samples/digital-manufacturing-extension-samples and cannot do a POST call to an S/4HANA cloud ODATA api .

execute: function () {

            if (this.getPodSelectionModel().getOperation() && this.getPodSelectionModel().getOperation().routing) {
                console.log("Order ID in process is : ", this.podSelectionModel.getOperation().routing);
                let sOrder = this.podSelectionModel.getOperation().routing;
                let self = this;
                return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {

                    let oDataModel = new ODataModel({
                        "serviceUrl": "https://" + window.location.host + "/destination/S4-Dev-Label-api/",
                        "earlyRequests": true,
                        "operationMode": "Server",
                        "groupId": "$direct",
                        "synchronizationMode": "None",
                        "odataVersion": "4.0"
                    });
                    let oView = self.getPodController().getView();
                    oView.setModel(oDataModel, "pluginExtModel");
                    oView.bindElement({ path: "/ZC_PROD_LABEL('" + sOrder + "')", model: "pluginExtModel" });
                    var oBindingContext = oView.getBindingContext("pluginExtModel");
                    
                    let oActionODataContextBinding = oView.getModel("pluginExtModel").bindContext("com.sap.gateway.srvd_a2x.zser_mfg_label.v0001.printForm(...)", oBindingContext);
                    
                    oActionODataContextBinding.invoke()
                        .then(() => {
                            const oActionContext = oActionODataContextBinding.getBoundContext();
                            console.log(oActionContext.getObject());
                            MessageToast.show("Submitted to S/4HANA Print queue!");
                            resolve();
                        },
                            (oError) => {
                                MessageBox.alert(oError.message, {
                                    icon: MessageBox.Icon.ERROR,
                                    title: "Error"
                                });
                                console.log(oError.message);
                                resolve();
                            });
                });


            } else {
                MessageBox.error("Please select an Order first.");
            }

            return true;
        },

 The destination is configured in BTP cockpit subaccount where DMC subscription is.

The plugin is assigned to an action button and when the call is happening, in the network tab of developer's console, I can see the CSRF token is passed in the request header but it is not valid for the S/4HANA backend. It seems the CSRF token is issued from the BTP destination itself but not the backend.

I also tried with adding the destination in the managed destination service instance  created after deployment of the plugin to cloud foundry:

Added the following the app router xsapp.json with csrfProtection as false to allow for the backend to issue the token instead of the destination itself:

{
  "welcomeFile": "/podplugins/index.html",
  "authenticationMethod": "none",
  "logout": {
    "logoutEndpoint": "/do/logout"
  },
  "routes": [
    {
      "source": "^/podplugins/(.*)$",
      "target": "$1",
      "localDir": "webapp"
    },
    {
      "source": "https://<my-dmc-host-url>/destination/S4-Dev-Label-api/(.*)$",
      "target": "$1",
      "destination": "SAP_API",
      "authenticationType": "XSUAA",
      "csrfProtection": false
    }
  ]
}

But above change in approuter fails when deploying it to CF.

Error starting application "udhgdmc-executionplugin": Some instances have crashed. Check the logs of your application for more information.
Download the application logs via the dmol command and check them for more information.
A step of the process has failed. Retrying it may solve the issue.
Process failed.
Use "cf deploy -i a49c75d8-ab91-11f0-9368-eeee0a87f9d9 -a abort" to abort the process.
Use "cf deploy -i a49c75d8-ab91-11f0-9368-eeee0a87f9d9 -a retry" to retry the process.
Use "cf dmol -i a49c75d8-ab91-11f0-9368-eeee0a87f9d9" to download the logs of the process.
Exit error code: 1

I checked this documentation and it says need to fetch x-csrf-token for POST calls. Does this mean that I need to implement REST api call in javascript and not using ODatamodel as I did here?

 @tobias_renth  @Kevin_Hunter1 @ManoelCosta 

Best regards,

Sumit

entry.title: Re: SAP Crystal Reports for Visual Studio SP37 print some...
entry.content:
Wow, I've never seen that happen before, it's not just the whole number but each part separated by the comma....

See if SP 38 fixes the issue:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SUPPORT_CONTENT/crystalreports/3354091173.html?locale=en-US

Try exporting to PDF and see if fixes the issue?

I tried downloading that driver for Windows 11 and it's not listed.

Do you know if there is a PCL or PS driver for that printer?

See if one of those will work for you.

Old HP drivers caused all sorts of issues with CR, nothing CR could do, HP had to fix them....

The odd thing is CR formats the report and then generates an EPF file to send to the printer, it's an image of the page...

Do you have a full version of CR Designer or are you using the Embedded Report Designer in VS to preview the report?

So that suggests it is CR formatting the number. Try setting your number delimiter to Canada, it uses a period as the decimal point. 

It could be  the comma is causing CR to format the number.

What version of Windows are you using?

weird one....

entry.title: SAP Business Network Continues to Receive Top Accolades From Peer Reviews
entry.content:
SAP is excited to share that its B2B trading partner platform, SAP Business Network, has received significant recognition from two leading peer review firms—TrustRadius and G2.

For the second year in a row, SAP Business Network has received a Top Rated award from TrustRadius in the Supply Chain Visibility software category. This recognition is due to the satisfaction that SAP customers have experienced with SAP Business Network, and their willingness to share their views publicly.

According to TrustRadius, the awards are based entirely on customer feedback, received, scored, and verified by the platform. TrustRadius describes the Supply Chain Visibility category as software that “tracks the production and shipment of assets between suppliers, manufacturers, retailers, distributors, and customers from a centralized platform. Supply Chain Visibility software offers tracking, analytics, and reporting on products, orders, and raw materials.”   

"SAP Business Network earning a TrustRadius Top Rated award highlights its impact in streamlining and strengthening global supply chain collaboration,” said Allyson Havener, Chief Marketing Officer at TrustRadius. “Within their reviews, customers consistently call out the platform for increasing transparency, improving partner connectivity, and driving operational efficiency.”

Through SAP’s partnership with TrustRadius, prospective customers have been able to obtain first-hand feedback from SAP Business Network customers with respect to their satisfaction with their deployments, product functionality, and business outcomes. Product reviews and ratings provide an objective viewpoint, as well as valuable product, feature, and benefit information about the SAP Business Network solution portfolio.

For example, in one review, the general manager in research and development at a large pharmaceuticals company referred to SAP Business Network as “a powerful platform that enhances collaboration and efficiency across various functions in the pharmaceutical industry.” Similarly, an engineer in a small engineering firm considers SAP Business Network to be one of the best tools to build a stronger supply chain network and “deliver on the end user promise…closing the gaps between trading partners, enabling transaction exchange, information sharing, and partner discovery.”

The SAP Business Network Market Report, developed in collaboration with TrustRadius, summarizes customer sentiment from the ratings:

  • 97% of reviewers would buy SAP Business Network again
  • 85% are satisfied with its feature set
  • 89% believe it delivers good value for the price
  • Usability Rating: 8.7/10
  • Likelihood to Recommend: 8.6/10

In addition to the recognition provided by TrustRadius, SAP Business Network has also been designated as both a Leader and a Momentum Leader by G2 in the Supply Chain Business Networks category. According to G2, products in the Leader quadrant, as defined by G2, are rated highly by G2 users and have substantial Market Presence scores. This award confirms that SAP Business Network maintains its leadership amongst our peers, as well as continues to build momentum in the marketplace, according to G2’s algorithms and comprehensive evaluation, together with verified customer reviews. Customers reviewing SAP Business Network on G2 have referred to the solution as a “game-changer,” “hassle-free,” and “a large network which can be trusted and work efficiently in the large scale.”

G2 defines the Supply Chain Business Networks category as follows:

Supply Chain Business Network software helps businesses create efficient supply chain ecosystems. These solutions offer tools to find, compare, and evaluate suitable suppliers, distributors, or manufacturers to support a company’s supply chain needs. To qualify for inclusion in the Supply Chain Business Networks category, a product must:

 - Provide a platform to search and develop supply chain business relations 
 - Connect businesses with various suppliers across the globe
 - Allow visibility to compare supplier orders and quotes
 - Provide software tools to help manage a supply chain end-to-end

The SAP Business Network team deeply appreciates the trust that our customers have placed in us. For more information about SAP Business Network visit us online. In addition, to learn more about how SAP Business Network can provide value for your organization, try our online business value calculator, developed in collaboration with IDC.*

* Developed by IDC, sponsored by SAP
